name: bash
description: Execute shell commands asynchronously via bash. **IMPORTANT:** This tool runs asynchronously by default - it returns immediately with an operation_id and the result is delivered via notification when complete. Use this for commands that may take time (tests, builds, file operations). The system will automatically notify you when the operation completes - do NOT poll or repeatedly check status. Continue with other work while waiting for the notification.

subcommand.name: default
subcommand.description: Execute a bash command asynchronously. Returns immediately with operation details; completion notification delivered automatically.

positional_args.name: command
positional_args.description: The shell command to execute (e.g., 'ls -la', 'sleep 5', 'echo hello')
